meanings.definition: The act of making brass or brass-like.
meanings.sent1: The brassing of the doorknob gave it a shiny appearance.
meanings.sent2: I learned about brassing in my science class.
meanings.sent3: The brassing of the statue made it look like a golden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her skillful brassing turned the dull metal into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The brassing process involves heating and shaping the metal.

meanings.sent1: The antique vase was made of a beautiful brassing.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry was crafted from a rare brassing.
meanings.sent3: The brassing used in the sculpture gave it a unique shine.
meanings.sent4: The brassing in the old clock gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The brassing material was perfect for creating durable tools.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with brass.
meanings.sent1: She decided to brass the doorknob for a new look.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman brassed the edges of the mirror for a decorative touch.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally brassed his shoes instead of polishing them.
meanings.sent4: The artist brassed the frame of the painting to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent5: Brassing the instrument made it more resistant to corrosion.

meanings.sent1: Her brassing in asking for a raise impressed her boss.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's brassing on stage made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent3: His brassing in challenging the authority led to unexpected results.
meanings.sent4: The student showed great brassing by speaking up in class.
meanings.sent5: The politician's brassing during the debate caught everyone's attention.
